result.execSummary:
The defendant Cassidy A Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court allows Agent to determine if a no-alcohol consumption condition should be imposed. 
** Amended 1/19/16 - applied $150 cash bond. **

miscConds.notes: Includes domestic abuse surcharge. ** Amended 1/19/16 - applied $150 cash bond. **
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
